title: Regression Candidates: The Good and the Bad!  (05/20 Fantasy Football Podcast)
description:
We've got negative regression and positive regression (yes, that's a thing) candidates. The headliners are Aaron Rodgers (3:30) and Michael Thomas (10:30), but there is much more to cover. Regression QBs (18:30) include Kirk Cousins, Ryan Tannehill and Daniel Jones. RBs (31:00) include Nick Chubb, Derrick Henry and Miles Sanders. Can we really make much of Sanders's 2020 season? Will Henry's regression matter enough for him to be outside the Top 5 at RB? ... We move on to WRs (43:10) and discuss the all three Steelers guys! Chase Claypool needs more targets to score that many TDs. Do Diontae Johnson's drops matter? We also talk about the Panthers WRs and if they'll find the end zone more frequently. And finally, TE talk (55) headlined by Noah Fant (55:15) ... Email us at fantasyfootball@cbsi.com
'Fantasy Football Today' is available on Apple Podcasts, Spotify, Stitcher, Google Podcasts, Castbox, and wherever else you listen to podcasts.
Follow our FFT team on Twitter: @FFToday, @AdamAizer, @JameyEisenberg, @daverichard, @heathcummingssr, @ctowerscbs, @BenSchragg
Watch FFT on YouTube https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCviK78rIWXhZdFzJ1Woi7Fg/videos
Join our Facebook group https://www.facebook.com/groups/FantasyFootballToday/
Sign up for the FFT newsletter https://www.cbssports.com/newsletter
You can listen to Fantasy Football Today on your smart speakers! Simply say "Alexa, play the latest episode of the Fantasy Football Today podcast" or "Hey Google, play the latest episode of the Fantasy Football Today podcast."
To hear more from the CBS Sports Podcast Network, visit https://www.cbssports.com/podcasts/
 
To learn more about listener data and our privacy practices visit: https://www.audacyinc.com/privacy-policy

itunes:title: Regression Candidates: The Good and the Bad!  (05/20 Fantasy Football Podcast)
itunes:author: CBS Sports, Fantasy Football, Rookies, Rankings, Waiver Wire
itunes:subtitle: We'll highlight a bunch of players who are due for regression (positive or negative) including Aaron Rodgers, Nick Chubb, Derrick Henry, Diontae Johnson & Noah Fant. ALSO: Is Spiderman kind of a loser?
